concept.title: Managing your contacts
concept.shortdesc: Tap the menu icon and then Contacts to display the Contacts screen. The Contacts screen displays your groups. When you expand the groups, the app shows the individuals in the groups.

conbody.p: When you are online, by default only contacts that are also online are visible but you can change this behavior in settings. The contacts screen is a list of your personal and public groups.

Personal groups are those that you create for organizing your own contacts. Public groups are those that an administrator created and populated with contacts. You can create a hierarchy of groups and contacts under your personal groups, but public groups are static. They can be added as subgroups to personal groups, but you cannot add contacts or subgroups to a public group.

As you navigate throughout your contacts hierarchy, each screen has a menu icon () at the top. Tapping this icon displays a list of appropriate actions. Actions on the main Contacts screen are different than actions on a personal or public group screen.

There are several options available by long pressing the group name on the Contacts screen.
Rename a group
Remove a group
Send an announcement
Start a group chat
